column2: Goal 4: Ensure inclusive and equitable quality education and promoted lifelong learning oppurtunities for all
column3: Children out of school (% of primary school age)
column6: Percentage of primary-school-age children who are not enrolled in primary or secondary school. Children in the official primary age group that are in preprimary education should be considered out of school.
Duration of compulsory education is the number of years that children are legally obliged to attend school.

column2: Goal 5. Achieve gender equality and empower all women and girls
column3: Proportion of seats held by women in national parliaments (%)
column6: Percentage of parliamentary seats in a single or lower chamber held by women.

column3: Women Business and the Law Index Score (scale 1-100)
column6: index measures how laws and regulations affect women? economic opportunity. Overall scores are calculated by taking the average score of each of the eight areas (Going Places, Starting a Job, Getting Paid, Getting Married, Having Children, Running a Business, Managing Assets and Getting a Pension), with 100 representing the highest possible score.

column2: Goal 7. Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all

column3: Renewable electricity output (% of total electricity output)
column6: Share of electrity generated by renewable power plants in total electricity generated by all types of plants.

column2: Goal 2. End hunger, achieve food security and improved nutrition and promote sustainable agriculture

column2: Goal 1. End poverty in all its forms everywhere
column3: Proportion of population using basic drinking water services, by location (%)

column3: Proportion of population below international poverty line (%)
column6: Percentage of the population living on less than $1.90 a day at 2011 international prices. The international poverty line is currently set at $1.90 a day at 2011 international prices.
